wikipedia_page.main: William Hetherington Shipley was a 19th-century painter and decorator based in South Shields who was also an early pioneer in the world of ballooning and parachuting

response: * William Hetherington Shipley, 19th-century painter, decorator and early pioneer in ballooning and parachuting

link_mentions.page: Allan's Illustrated Edition of Tyneside Songs and Readings
response: |575||William Hetherington Shipley's Drop frae the Cloods ||Geordie – pseudonym of writer||||published in the Shields Gazette

link_mentions.page: List of Geordie characters, events and places
response: * William Hetherington Shipley - The subject of a song/poem and a parachutist appeared in the song "Shipley's Drop frae the Cloods" (author used the pseudonym "Georgie" when it was published in the Shields Gazette). The song also appears on page 575 in Thomas Allan's Illustrated Edition of Tyneside Songs and Readings with a brief bio.
